Elastic Net (Lasso and Ridge)

Source: R/penalties.R
elasticNet.Rd

The elastic net penalty is a mix of the lasso (L1) and ridge (L2) regularization penalties. This mix is controlled by alpha, where a value of 1 imposes the lasso penalty and 0 the ridge penalty, whereas anything in between serves as a combination of the two.

elasticNet(lambda = NULL, lambda_min_ratio = 1e-04, n_lambda = 100,
  alpha = 1)

Arguments

lambda

the regularization strength, which can either be a user-supplied vector of (theoreticall) any length, or NULL, in which case golem automatically computes a sequence so that the first value leads to the null (intercept-only) model.
lambda_min_ratio

the lowest permissible value of the lambda penalty
n_lambda

the length of the \(\lambda\) sequence -- ignored if a value is supplied to lambda.
alpha

the elastic net mix, 1 for the lasso penalty, 0 for the ridge, and anything in between for a mix of the two (the elastic net)

Value

A paramter pack for the elastic net penalty.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
